content.question: The function f has first derivative given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>.</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43FC@</annotation> </semantics> </math> What is the x-coordinate of the inflection point of the graph of f ?

choices.label: The graph of f has no inflection point.

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
